title: Inspiring Entomological Exploration Via X-ray Microscopy and Virtual Reality in Outreach, Research, and Teaching
content: X-ray computed microtomography (micro-CT) and X-ray microscopy (XRM) allows in-depth 3D reconstruction & analysis of entomological specimens without damaging the specimen. Compared to microtomy or physical dissection, digital dissection and manipulation using 3D X-ray data is preferable for unique specimens, museum collections, or samples where it is important that structures or internal anatomy remain undisturbed [1]. The reliability of micro-CT models for anatomical study allows for multiple dissections of the same individual that can be compared with other datasets at a quality comparable to a real dissection [2].
